comment.author: 47524421@N08
comment._content: Handley Page Halifax B Mark II Series 1A, LW263 'EY-E', of No. 78 Squadron RAF based at Breighton, Yorkshire. Outwardly the Mk. II srs 1A was identifiable by the clear perspex nose bubble and lower profile four gun mid-upper turret. This aircraft has been fitted with the larger "D" fins which finally cured the Halifax's unfortunate rudder stalling tendancy during violent evasive maneuvers. Here is another photo of this same aircraft in flight. Below is Halifax B Mark II Series 1A LW235 EY-B, also of No. 78 Squadron, showing the earlier triangular fins. Both photos from the Imperial War Museum Collection.
